usefulItems: large bowl, cling film, rolling pin, frying pan, paper towel, hob
title: Fried Cheese and Tomato Pizzas

ingredients.content: 300 g strong white bread flour, plus extra for flouring
100 g pecorino cheese, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)

preparations.content: Place 100 g water, sugar and yeast in mixing bowl then warm <b>2 min/37°C/speed 2<b>. Meanwhile, grease a large bowl with oil.

Add semolina, flour, salt and remaining 250 g water then knead <b>5 min/<b>. Transfer dough to prepared bowl, cover with cling film then set aside to rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1-2 hours). Towards end of rising time, prepare topping.
Place pecorino cheese in mixing bowl and chop <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer half to a small bowl and set aside.
Add garlic and oil then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then heat <b>5 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.
Add tomatoes, salt, basil and oregano then cook <b>10 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
On a lightly floured work surface, knead dough gently. Divide into 25 golf ball sized pieces then roll into circles (approx. Ø 10 cm). Cover with cling film and allow to rest for 15 minutes.

Heat a little oil in a frying pan then fry dough circles, 3-4 pieces at a time, over a medium-high heat, until cooked through (approx. 2-3 minutes) then drain on paper towels. Blot excess oil with paper towels then spread tomato sauce onto fried bases and sprinkle with reserved grated pecorino.

hintsAndTricks: Add other toppings to the pizzas (e.g. anchovies, capers, olives, salami...)
Keep dough balls covered with cling film until frying to prevent dough from drying out.
